intellimate.izou.events

Class EventDistributor

  • java.lang.Object
    • intellimate.izou.events.EventDistributor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class EventDistributor
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    This class gets all the Events from all registered EventPublisher, generates Resources and passes them to the OutputManager

    • Method Detail

      • registerEventPublisher

        public java.util.Optional<EventPublisher> registerEventPublisher(Identification identification)
        with this method you can register EventPublisher add a Source of Events to the System.

        This method represents a higher level of abstraction! Use the EventManager to fire Events! This method is intended for use cases where you have an entire new source of events (e.g. network)

        Parameters:
        identification - the Identification of the Source
        Returns:
        An Optional Object which may or may not contains an EventPublisher

      • unregisterEventPublisher

        public void unregisterEventPublisher(Identification identification)
        with this method you can unregister EventPublisher add a Source of Events to the System.

        This method represents a higher level of abstraction! Use the EventManager to fire Events! This method is intended for use cases where you have an entire new source of events (e.g. network)

        Parameters:
        identification - the Identification of the Source

      • registerEventsController

        public void registerEventsController(EventsController controller)
                              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Registers an EventController to control EventDispatching-Behaviour

        Method is thread-safe. It is expected that this method executes quickly.

        Parameters:
        controller - the EventController Interface to control event-dispatching
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • unregisterEventsController

        public void unregisterEventsController(EventsController controller)
        Unregisters an EventController

        Method is thread-safe.

        Parameters:
        controller - the EventController Interface to remove

      • registerEventListener

        public void registerEventListener(Event event,
                                  EventListener eventListener)
        Adds an listener for events.

        Be careful with this method, it will register the listener for ALL the informations found in the Event. If your event-type is a common event type, it will fire EACH time!. It will also register for all Descriptors individually! It will also ignore if this listener is already listening to an Event. Method is thread-safe.

        Parameters:
        event - the Event to listen to (it will listen to all descriptors individually!)
        eventListener - the ActivatorEventListener-interface for receiving activator events

      • registerEventListener

        public void registerEventListener(java.util.List<java.lang.String> ids,
                                  EventListener eventListener)
        Adds an listener for events.

        It will register for all ids individually! This method will ignore if this listener is already listening to an Event. Method is thread-safe.

        Parameters:
        ids - this can be type, or descriptors etc.
        eventListener - the ActivatorEventListener-interface for receiving activator events

      • unregisterEventListener

        public void unregisterEventListener(Event event,
                                    EventListener eventListener)
                             throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        unregister an EventListener It will unregister for all Descriptors individually! It will also ignore if this listener is not listening to an Event. Method is thread-safe.
        Parameters:
        event - the Event to stop listen to
        eventListener - the ActivatorEventListener used to listen for events
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if Listener is already listening to the Event or the id is not allowed

      • getEvents

        public java.util.concurrent.BlockingQueue<Event> getEvents()

      • run

        public void run()
        When an object implementing interface Runnable is used to create a thread, starting the thread causes the object's run method to be called in that separately executing thread.

        The general contract of the method run is that it may take any action whatsoever.

        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        See Also:
        Thread.run()

      • timeOut

        public java.util.List<java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture> timeOut(java.util.List<java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture> futures)
        creates a 1 sec. timeout for the resource-generation
        Parameters:
        futures - a List of futures running
        Returns:
        list with all elements removed, who aren't finished after 1 sec
